revised_title: Characterization and Properties of Palladium: A Newly Discovered Metal
tldr: In this article, the author, Richard Chenevix, investigates a newly discovered metallic substance called palladium, which was being sold in London. He conducts various experiments to determine its properties and behavior, including its reaction with acids, alkalis, and other metals. Chenevix finds that palladium is not easily soluble in most acids and forms alloys with other metals. He also observes its specific gravity, hardness, and other characteristics, concluding that it is a unique and distinct metal.
